user.name: Pub Meeple
user.description: We're just four dads that play and design board games. Check out our website, podcast, and YouTube channel for DIY resources, our game ranking tool and more.

text: Please don't teach a game you haven't learned. Reading a rule book out loud to a group can be excruciating. Be willing to say no.

user.name: Pub Meeple
user.description: We're just four dads that play and design board games. Check out our website, podcast, and YouTube channel for DIY resources, our game ranking tool and more.

text: Get players involved. Let them move components as if playing the game. Keep them engaged. Ask questions to make sure they are following.

user.name: Pub Meeple
user.description: We're just four dads that play and design board games. Check out our website, podcast, and YouTube channel for DIY resources, our game ranking tool and more.

text: Have the game set up before you teach if possible. Then you can use components to illustrate what you are teaching.

user.name: Pub Meeple
user.description: We're just four dads that play and design board games. Check out our website, podcast, and YouTube channel for DIY resources, our game ranking tool and more.

text: Anchor your teaching in the theme as much as possible. The theme is the shortcut to your players understanding and remembering the rules.

user.name: Pub Meeple
user.description: We're just four dads that play and design board games. Check out our website, podcast, and YouTube channel for DIY resources, our game ranking tool and more.

text: Use the summary you made to stay on track. Don't get bogged down in exceptions or sub-rules.

user.name: Pub Meeple
user.description: We're just four dads that play and design board games. Check out our website, podcast, and YouTube channel for DIY resources, our game ranking tool and more.

text: Teach the basics. Get into the game as quickly as possible. Let some of the learning take place during the learning game.

user.name: Pub Meeple
user.description: We're just four dads that play and design board games. Check out our website, podcast, and YouTube channel for DIY resources, our game ranking tool and more.

text: When teaching heavier games, I use the Learning Game - the first goal of this game is is learning,fun and experimenting, then winning.
